node.title: Australian chairman of selectors too close to Paine to make final call on his future
node.alt: A Tasmanian cricketer smiles and high fives a wicketkeeper jumping in the air to celebrate a Shield wicket.
node.description: George Bailey says he would not make a casting vote ifÂ the Australian selectors were divided on Tim Paine's future with the team, given his friendship and business links to the former Australian skipper.
node.content:
["Australian cricket's chairman of selectors George Bailey has shared his concern\u00a0for his friend Tim Paine in the wake of his resignation as captain, and said he will not be part of deciding Paine's place on the team if it comes to a vote.", "Paine announced he was standing down as Australian captain in an emotional press conference last Friday.", "It came after revelations\u00a0he was involved in a sexting scandal dating back to 2017.", "He was cleared of breaching the code of conduct in a 2018 Cricket Australia investigation, but Paine said that, in retrospect,\u00a0his \"actions in 2017 do not meet the standard of an Australian cricket captain or the wider community\".", "Paine has said he still wants to play in the upcoming Ashes series against England, with the intention of retiring at the end of the summer.", "Chairman of selectors Bailey is a longtime friend of Paine.", "They were teammates in the Tasmanian team and the\u00a0pair are co-investors in a group of gyms in the state.", "Speaking on the Cricket Etcetera podcast for The Australian, Bailey was asked if he was concerned for his friend after the events of the past few days.", "\"Yeah, absolutely [I'm concerned] \u2026 I don\u2019t think it would be normal if I hadn't\u00a0been,\" Bailey said.", "Bailey said he did not get much warning the texting story was about to break.", "\"Not a great deal \u2014\u00a0I spoke to Tim mid-morning on Friday. [That]\u00a0was sort of the first I'd heard of it,\" he said.", "\"And it wasn't a long conversation, so I haven't had a chance to catch up with him.\"", "", "
Tim Paine has quit the Australian captaincy but said he wants to play on for the Ashes series before retirement.\u00a0(ABC News: Luke Bowden)
", "Bailey is the chairman of selectors on a panel with new member Tony Dodemaide and Australian coach Justin Langer.", "\"They (Dodemaide and Langer) are\u00a0both aware of that \u2026 Tim Paine's the only close friend I have, and I think since the day I was given the opportunity to have this role\u00a0we've been aware that that's the case.", "\"I have strong friendships and relationships that go back years with a number of players. And that can be seen a number of ways \u2014\u00a0that there might be a tendency to go easier, or vice-versa, you could be harder on those players at times.\"", "Paine is playing this week for the Tasmanian 2nd XI against the South Australian 2nd XI\u00a0in Hobart as he tries to build his fitness ahead of the Ashes. He has not played in six months due to his recovery from neck surgery.\u00a0", "Bailey said selectors had conversations all the time regarding older players.", "\"Tim's position aside, that's the same thing we do when we're talking about David Warner at the age he is at the top of the order, or looking at our three fast bowlers we've been reliant on.", "\"[Or]\u00a0Nathan Lyon \u2014 that's obviously a constant conversation about how important he's been to the team over the years \u2014 and they're all at an age where you have to be prepared for it (change or retirement).\"", "Bailey said Paine had always been meticulous with his preparation but acknowledged it was not an ideal lead-in to the Ashes.", "\"I think one thing Tim's always been pretty good with has been the preparation side of things,\" he said.", "\"He's quite meticulous so \u2026 there's no doubt it's not an ideal preparation [for the Ashes]\u00a0but we'll obviously watch this game and he'll know how he gets through the four days as much as anyone.", "\"I don't think there will necessarily be a skill problem. But no doubt of the next 58 days, 25 of them are pretty heavy days of cricket potentially. It's something to beware of\"."]
